content: Fire suppression revenue was $38.8 million, up 28% from 2021, driven by 2 additional Scooper aircraft in service for the full season in 2022. Looking to the fourth quarter, which is the quarter where we typically schedule much of our annual maintenance activities for our fleet, revenue was $1.1 million compared to $0.7 million in the fourth quarter of 2021. Selling, general and administrative expenses were $6.5 million in the fourth quarter compared to $4.2 million in the fourth quarter of 2021. For the fourth quarter of 2022, net loss was $17 million compared to a net loss of $11.1 million in the fourth quarter of 2021.
